column4: can anyone help me with getting an intel wireless card connecting to a network?
lspci will identify it, you can websearch from there
http://www.usenet-forums.com/linux-networking/61712-change-eth1-wlan0.html
thanks, but that doesn't really help - I have no conflict on eth1, I'm just worried it's not being detected as wireless properly..
it will help you rename it to wlan0
i think (as you say) it doesnt matter
hmm Ok. iwconfig shows "unassociated" under access point. I think that might be the problem
you could try manually populating /etc/network/interfaces to test
I will try that, brb a couple of mins.
just got told I don't have permission to edit interfaces
gksudo gedit /etc/network/interfaces
thanks, all saved. Do I need to restart or reload ubuntu?
you need to run: sudo /etc/init.d/networking restart
All done, still nothing new though.
Any ideas? I added the network in Network Connections -> Wireless, but no luck. Should it be finding the network automatically?
if you rename the interfaces file you editted and reboot you will have no network config which may help, you wil get a blank config which you can resetup
Ok, how would I do that?
sudo mv /etc/network/interfaces /etc/network/interfaces_old
Thanks, rebooting.
OK, I have no interface file now, but my wired and wireless connections are still saved
ok now fire up your connection manager software and setup
